alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued February 27 at 2:54PM EST until February 27 at 3:15PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTY... At 254 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Miamisburg, moving northeast at 45 mph. This storm previously produced a tornado and may generate another tornado at any time. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Kettering, Miamisburg, Springboro, Bellbrook, Moraine, Oakwood, West Carrollton, Riverside, Centerville and Woodbourne-Hyde Park. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 42 and 52. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
